1.description: Now fourteen years old, Percy goes on a mission with Annabeth, Thalia, and Grover to rescue two new half-bloods at Westover Hall boarding school.

3.description: Witnesses Annabeth being taken by the manticore Dr. Thorn after she pushes him out of the way. Feels responsible for her capture.

6.description: Desperately wants to join the quest to rescue Artemis and find Annabeth, but is excluded from the quest prophecy. Struggles with feeling helpless.

11.description: Follows the quest anyway, accompanied by Nico di Angelo. Determined to save Annabeth despite not being chosen for the quest.

19.description: Helps defeat Atlas and rescue both Artemis and Annabeth. Takes on some of Atlas's burden temporarily to free Artemis for battle.
19.role: Hero who helped defeat a Titan

1.description: Now fourteen years old and leading a mission to recruit two new half-bloods from Westover Hall. More experienced and confident in her abilities.

3.description: Captured by Dr. Thorn, the manticore, after pushing Percy out of harm's way. Her sacrifice saves Percy but puts her in great danger.

18.description: Found to be holding up the sky in Atlas's place on Mount Tamalpais. Has been tortured but remains strong and defiant.

19.description: Rescued when Percy takes her place holding the sky temporarily. Helps in the final battle against Atlas and Luke.

1.description: Now alive and fifteen years old, daughter of Zeus with powers over lightning and the sky. Still getting used to being alive again after years as a tree.

4.description: Struggles with her powers and the knowledge that she could fulfill the Great Prophecy about a child of the Big Three reaching sixteen.

6.description: Chosen as one of the five questers to rescue Artemis and search for Annabeth. Her lightning powers and leadership experience are valuable.

20.description: Joins the Hunters of Artemis to avoid the burden of the Great Prophecy and finds a new family with the immortal huntresses.

1.description: Still searching for Pan while serving as a protector. Joins the mission to Westover Hall to help rescue two new half-bloods.

6.description: Chosen as one of the questers to rescue Artemis. His wilderness skills and ability to track make him valuable to the quest.

11.description: Continues the quest while worried about Percy, who has gone missing. His empathy link with Percy helps him sense his friend's condition.

1.description: A twelve-year-old girl at Westover Hall who seems to be one of the half-bloods Percy's group came to rescue. Very protective of her younger brother Nico.

4.description: Revealed to be a daughter of Hades, making her one of the forbidden children of the Big Three. Has been living with memory issues about her past.

5.description: Chooses to join the Hunters of Artemis, becoming immortal and abandoning her previous life. This decision upsets her brother Nico greatly.

6.description: Chosen as one of the five questers despite being the newest Hunter. Her powers over shadows and the dead prove valuable.

15.description: Dies in Hephaestus's junkyard while trying to retrieve a figurine for Nico. Her death fulfills part of the quest prophecy and devastates her brother.

1.description: A ten-year-old boy at Westover Hall, very close to his older sister Bianca. Seems innocent and playful, obsessed with a card game called Mythomagic.

4.description: Revealed to be a son of Hades, making him another forbidden child of the Big Three. Has been living with altered memories about his past.

5.description: Devastated when Bianca chooses to join the Hunters of Artemis, effectively abandoning him. Feels betrayed and alone at Camp Half-Blood.

11.description: Follows Percy on his unauthorized quest to help rescue Bianca and Artemis. Shows developing powers over the dead and shadows.

15.description: Witnesses his sister's death in Hephaestus's junkyard. His grief and anger begin to manifest his powers over death and the underworld more strongly.

20.description: Blames Percy for Bianca's death and runs away from Camp Half-Blood. His powers over death and shadows are growing stronger as his emotions intensify.

3.description: Lieutenant of the Hunters of Artemis who arrives to help fight Dr. Thorn. Ancient and skilled in combat, speaks in an archaic manner.

4.description: Extremely loyal to Artemis and suspicious of male heroes, especially Percy. Has served Artemis for over two thousand years.

6.description: Chosen to lead the quest to rescue Artemis. Despite her distrust of males, she must work with Percy and others to save her mistress.

16.description: Revealed to be one of Atlas's daughters, the Hesperides, who betrayed her father long ago. This is why she has such ancient knowledge and guilt.

19.description: Dies from wounds inflicted by her father Atlas during the final battle. Her sacrifice helps save Artemis and becomes a constellation in death.

3.description: Goddess of the hunt and moon who arrives with her Hunters to help fight Dr. Thorn. Appears as a twelve-year-old girl but with ancient, powerful presence.

5.description: Accepts Bianca di Angelo into her Hunters, making her immortal. Explains the duties and sacrifices required of her followers.

6.description: Goes missing while hunting a powerful monster. The Oracle's prophecy reveals that a quest must be undertaken to rescue her.

19.description: Found captured by Atlas, forced to hold up the sky in his place. Freed when Percy temporarily takes the burden, allowing her to fight Atlas.

7.description: God of music, poetry, and the sun who appears as a young man driving a sun chariot (disguised as a Maserati). Twin brother of Artemis.
7.role: God of the sun and music

8.description: Gives the questers a ride in his sun chariot and provides cryptic advice. His terrible poetry and haikus are a running joke among the characters.

20.description: Appears at the Winter Solstice meeting on Olympus. Supports his sister Artemis and helps decide the fates of the heroes.

16.description: Ancient Titan who was condemned to hold up the sky for eternity. Father of the Hesperides and Zoë Nightshade. Seeks revenge against the gods.

18.description: Tricked Artemis into taking his burden of holding up the sky so he could be free to help destroy Olympus. Plans to use his freedom for revenge.

19.description: Battles the heroes and kills his daughter Zoë before being tricked back into his eternal punishment of holding up the sky.

1.description: Vice principal of Westover Hall who seems suspicious. Takes a particular interest in Bianca and Nico di Angelo, the two half-bloods.

2.description: Revealed to be a manticore - a monster with a human face, lion's body, and scorpion tail that shoots poisonous spikes. Serves a mysterious 'General.'

3.description: Captures Annabeth during the battle and escapes with her. His mission was to bring the di Angelo children to his master, but settles for Annabeth.

16.description: Now serving as Atlas's lieutenant in the Titan army. Has a new scar on his face and seems more hardened and ruthless than before.

19.description: Battles against his former friends during the confrontation with Atlas. Shows no mercy toward those he once cared about.

4.description: Activities director at Camp Half-Blood, concerned about the implications of having three children of the Big Three at camp simultaneously.

6.description: Helps organize the quest to rescue Artemis and provides guidance to the questers. Understands the gravity of the situation with the Titans rising.

4.description: Camp director who continues to get Percy's name wrong. Seems more concerned than usual about the situation with multiple Big Three children.

20.description: Attends the Winter Solstice council meeting on Olympus. Participates in deciding the punishment for the Western gods' interference.

10.description: Goddess of love and beauty who appears to Percy in the junkyard. Gives cryptic advice about love and warns him about future challenges.

12.description: A black pegasus that Percy befriends and who becomes his loyal flying mount. Intelligent and able to communicate telepathically with Percy.

13.description: Helps Percy travel across the country by air, providing crucial transportation during his unauthorized quest to help rescue Artemis.

3.description: Immortal huntresses who serve Artemis. Skilled warriors who have sworn off romantic love for eternal youth.

20.description: Welcome Thalia Grace as their newest member after she chooses to join them rather than face the prophecy.

6.description: One of the Hunters of Artemis chosen for the quest to rescue their mistress. Skilled archer and tracker.

7.description: Becomes ill after being sabotaged, forcing the quest group to choose a replacement member.

1.description: Military school students at the dance, unaware of the supernatural drama unfolding around them.
Security guards at Westover Hall who patrol the buildings and grounds during events.

11.description: Undead warriors that spring from dragon's teeth. Ancient soldiers that serve Nico and other children of Hades.

15.description: Fight alongside Nico in Hephaestus's junkyard, showing his growing power over the dead.

12.description: A massive lion with impenetrable golden fur that attacks the quest group. One of the monsters sent by the enemy.

9.description: A massive wild boar that the group encounters during their journey. Large enough to carry multiple riders.

15.description: Bronze mechanical warriors created by Hephaestus to guard his junkyard. Attack intruders relentlessly.
A massive bronze giant automaton guarding Hephaestus's junkyard. Ancient protector activated by intrusion.
God of fire and metalworking who owns the junkyard. Creator of many automatons and mechanical devices.

20.description: God of messengers present at the Winter Solstice council meeting on Olympus.
Goddess of agriculture present at the Winter Solstice council meeting on Olympus.
God of the sea present at the Winter Solstice council, defending his son Percy's actions.
God of the Underworld present at the Winter Solstice council meeting on Olympus.
God of war present at the Winter Solstice council meeting on Olympus.

11.description: A half-cow, half-serpent creature that Percy rescues and names Bessie. Ancient and prophetically important.

19.description: Revealed to have the power to destroy Olympus if its entrails are burned by an enemy of the gods.

16.description: Nymphs who guard the Garden of the Hesperides where Atlas once held up the sky. Daughters of Atlas.
A dragon with one hundred heads that guards the golden apples in the Garden of the Hesperides.

17.description: Poisoned Zoë with its venomous breath during the battle at the Garden of the Hesperides.

16.description: The mysterious 'General' leading the Titan forces, revealed to be Atlas himself after being freed from his sky-bearing punishment.

1.description: A monster with a human head, lion body, and scorpion tail that shoots poisonous spikes.

11.description: Goddess of the rainbow who provides Iris-messaging services for divine communication.

17.description: Annabeth's mortal father who lives in San Francisco. Professor and expert in military history.
Annabeth's stepmother who has a tense relationship with her stepdaughter.
One of Annabeth's young half-brothers, son of Frederick and Mrs. Chase.
One of Annabeth's young half-brothers, son of Frederick and Mrs. Chase.

12.description: Winged horses that serve as transportation for the quest group. Can fly great distances.

11.description: Storm spirits that attack the group during their journey. Servants of chaotic forces.
Skeleton warriors that spring from planted dragon teeth, summoned by children of Hades.

9.description: A massive wild boar that becomes an unlikely ally, carrying the quest members on its back.

8.description: Twin sons of Ares with bear-like features who serve Luke and the Titan forces.

4.description: Various demigods at Camp Half-Blood dealing with the crisis of having three Big Three children present.

11.description: Magical communication system using rainbow mist, operated by the goddess Iris.

1.description: Magical force that obscures supernatural events from mortal perception.

11.description: Mortal taxi driver who gives Percy and Nico a ride, affected by the Mist to see normal explanations for strange events.

12.description: Mortal tourists visiting Hoover Dam who are oblivious to the supernatural events happening around them.
Tour guide at Hoover Dam who gives information about the dam's construction and history.

17.description: Various mortal residents of San Francisco who witness the supernatural battle but see it through the Mist.
Military helicopter pilot who helps Frederick Chase during the battle, controlled by Daedalus's inventions.
Ancient celestial bronze weapons and mechanical devices created by Daedalus, used by Frederick Chase.

15.description: Mechanical bronze warriors guarding Hephaestus's junkyard, programmed to attack intruders.
Stone lion statues that come to life in Hephaestus's junkyard to attack intruders.

9.description: Various wild animals encountered during the quest's journey through forests and wilderness areas.

16.description: Mountain nymphs and spirits dwelling in the areas around Mount Tamalpais and Mount Othrys.

10.description: Various nature spirits that Grover can communicate with during their journey through the wilderness.

19.description: A new constellation created by Artemis to honor Zoë Nightshade after her heroic death.

4.description: The lake at Camp Half-Blood where water activities take place, home to naiads and other water spirits.
The strawberry fields at Camp Half-Blood that help fund the camp through sales to mortals.
The forest surrounding Camp Half-Blood where capture the flag is played and various creatures live.

6.description: The mummified Oracle at Camp Half-Blood that gives prophecies. Speaks for the spirit of Delphi.

8.description: The disembodied voice of Kronos that speaks to Luke and influences his actions toward evil.

11.description: The psychic connection between Percy and Grover that allows them to sense each other's emotions and status.

recaps.1: Percy Jackson, now fourteen, goes on a mission with Annabeth, Thalia, and Grover to Westover Hall, a military boarding school, to rescue two half-blood siblings: Bianca and Nico di Angelo.
recaps.2: At the school dance, Dr. Thorn, the vice principal, reveals himself as a manticore and attacks the group. The situation becomes dangerous as he tries to capture the di Angelo children.
recaps.3: The Hunters of Artemis, led by Zoë Nightshade, arrive to help fight Dr. Thorn. During the battle, Annabeth pushes Percy out of the way and is captured by the manticore, who escapes with her.
recaps.4: The group returns to Camp Half-Blood where Bianca and Nico are revealed to be children of Hades. Artemis herself arrives at camp, and the situation becomes more complex with three Big Three children present.
recaps.5: Artemis offers Bianca a place among her immortal Hunters. Despite Nico's protests, Bianca accepts, choosing immortality and eternal youth over her mortal life with her brother.
recaps.6: Artemis goes missing while hunting a dangerous monster. The Oracle gives a prophecy about a quest to rescue the goddess, and five heroes are chosen: Zoë, Thalia, Bianca, Grover, and surprisingly, a fifth member to be revealed.
recaps.7: The quest begins, but Percy is not chosen to participate, despite his desperate desire to save Annabeth. The questers encounter Apollo, who gives them a ride in his sun chariot.
recaps.8: Apollo provides transportation and cryptic advice through his terrible poetry. The quest continues westward as the group seeks to find both Artemis and Annabeth.
recaps.9: The questers face various challenges and monsters as they travel across the country. Percy, left behind at camp, grows increasingly frustrated and worried about Annabeth.
recaps.10: Percy encounters Aphrodite in a vision, who gives him advice about love and warns him of upcoming challenges. Meanwhile, the quest party continues to face dangers.
recaps.11: Unable to stay behind any longer, Percy leaves camp with Nico di Angelo and Blackjack the pegasus to follow the quest and help save Annabeth.
recaps.12: Percy and Nico travel by air on Blackjack, tracking the quest. They encounter various obstacles and monsters as they try to catch up with the official quest party.
recaps.13: Percy and Nico continue their journey, with Percy's powers and Nico's emerging abilities over the dead helping them overcome challenges. They get closer to finding the quest.
recaps.14: The group faces more dangers as they approach their destination. Percy and Nico finally catch up with the quest party, though their arrival is not entirely welcome.
recaps.15: In Hephaestus's junkyard, the group faces mechanical monsters. During the battle, Bianca sacrifices herself to save the others, devastating her brother Nico and fulfilling part of the prophecy.
recaps.16: The group mourns Bianca's death and continues toward Mount Tamalpais. They discover that the mysterious 'General' they've been tracking is actually Atlas, the Titan.
recaps.17: Luke appears as Atlas's lieutenant, revealing his deeper involvement with the Titan army. The final confrontation approaches as the heroes prepare to face their greatest challenge.
recaps.18: The heroes reach Mount Tamalpais where they find Artemis holding up the sky in Atlas's place, and Annabeth imprisoned nearby. The trap set by Atlas becomes clear.
recaps.19: The final battle takes place on Mount Tamalpais. Percy temporarily takes Artemis's burden of holding up the sky, freeing her to fight Atlas. Zoë Nightshade dies in battle against her father Atlas, but the heroes ultimately triumph.
recaps.20: The heroes return to Olympus for the Winter Solstice. Thalia joins the Hunters of Artemis to avoid the Great Prophecy, Zoë becomes a constellation, and the gods debate the threat of the rising Titans. Nico blames Percy for Bianca's death and runs away, while his true parentage and powers are revealed.
